alert.note: Alert for Coastal Miami Dade County; Inland Miami-Dade County; Metropolitan Miami Dade (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 24 at 7:14PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Miami-Dade County through 745 PM EDT... At 714 PM EDT, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking a strong thunderstorm over Sunset, or over Kendall, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Miami, Miami Beach, Coral Gables, Key Biscayne, South Miami, Black Point, Virginia Key, Kendall, Doral, Pinecrest, Miami Springs, Sweetwater, West Miami, Westchester, Glenvar Heights, Fountainbleau, Richmond Heights, Palmetto Bay, Cutler Bay and Port Of Miami. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: These winds can down small tree limbs and branches, and blow around unsecured small objects. Seek shelter in a safe building until the storm passes. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Miami Dade County; Inland Miami-Dade County; Metropolitan Miami Dade
